Description: Type of metadata template; provide the same one for all items/rows.
The technology used to generate the data in this file.
Further qualification of dataType, which may be used to indicate the state of processing of the data, aggregation of the data, or presence of metadata.

Links an entity to data types that the entity represents/contains. This is closely tied to the assay property. For example, a file of dataType `genomicVariants` might have an assay value of `whole genome sequencing`.
Defined format of the data file, typically corresponding to extension, but sometimes indicating more general group of files produced by the same tool or software
A unique identifier (non-PII) that represents the individual from which the data came. This could be a patient or animal ID.
The type of resource being stored and annotated
The name of a species (typically a taxonomic group) of organism.
The type of tumor that the biospecimen used to generate the data were collected from.
The name of the file.
A numeric value representing age of the individual. Use with `ageUnit`.
A time unit that can be used with a given age value, e.g. years.
URI to supplemental asset(s), e.g. QC reports or other auxiliary files to support the processing, analysis, or interpretation of the current entity.
Brief free-text comments that may also be important to understanding the resource.
Diagnosis for the individual given signs and symptoms. Use the most specific diagnosis term that applies.
Measure used for transcript expression quantification

A group of presumed common ancestry with clear-cut physiological but usually not morphological distinctions such as an animal model or cell line. EXAMPLE(S):  HEK293 (cell line), Minnesota5 (swine strain), DXL (poultry strain), RB51 (vaccine strain of Brucella abortus)
Genotype of NF1 gene in the biospecimen from which the data were derived, if known.
Genotype of NF2 gene in the biospecimen from which the data were derived, if known
A unique macroscopic (gross) anatomic structure that performs specific functions. It is composed of various tissues. An organ is part of an anatomic system or a body region.
Phenotypic expression of chromosomal makeup that defines a study subject as male, female, or other.
Name and version of the workflow used to generate/analyze the data
Workflow URL reference
